Ian Garry wife name is Layla Anna-Lee. She was formerly known as Layla Machado.

Layla, a versatile British/Brazilian broadcaster, is well-known for her dynamic hosting skills on a variety of sports platforms.

She anchors her own UFC show, “UFC CONNECTED,” which brings fans closer to the action.

She co-hosts Cage Warriors live with Dan Hardy. Layla is also a popular host on Ultimate Boxxer, which airs on BT Sport and highlights her love of boxing.

Her role as an anchor in Red Bull Neymar Jr.’s Five, the world’s best 5-a-side competition, exemplifies her versatility.

Ian Garry wife Layla has also walked the French Alps for Channel 4’s Trois Etapes, reported from Austria during the Red Bull Airpower event, and hosted live studio coverage of the Indian Super League in Mumbai.

Layla Anna-Lee is married to UFC fighter Ian Garry and continues to succeed in her job, making substantial contributions to sports broadcasting.

I spent the entire time with this exact smile of my face - our Vegas wedding reflected our love perfectly. Wild, Fast, Bright, Colourful, Blinding and totally OTT."

He was born in October 2022. Layla also has another son, Lucas, who is from a previous relationship.

The family’s bond is heartwarming, with Ian Garry showing a deep commitment to his family, including his stepson Lucas.

The family of four lives happily together, cherishing their moments of togetherness.

Age and Career

Layla Anna-Lee was born in London, England, on March 22, 1983. According to her date of birth, she is 41 years old. Her zodiac sign is Aries.

She is the daughter of a Brazilian mother and an English father of Irish and Scottish descent.

Layla Anna-Lee is British and of mixed ethnic background. Her journey in the entertainment industry began at the age of six, when she appeared in a Fairy Liquid commercial.

Driven by her passion for performance, Ian Garry’s wife, Layla Anna-Lee, honed her acting and presentation skills at the prestigious Sylvia Young Theatre School in London.

Her debut as a television personality on CITV and Nickelodeon in 2008 marked the beginning of a career that would soon make her a household name in children’s programming.
